column4: well when i used nero to burn it, i selected data burn, then selected bootable data burn, and thats the only type of burn i did, could that be the problem?
and cryoniq, yes thats all i did
well thats what 4 other poeple said to do
and 2 of them fix computers for a living
sigh, it takes 8 and a half minutes for my computer to boot up :(
Ubuntu is what you make of it. It won't give you a flying car.
You're going to change your opreating system cause you're bored?
Its not going to be a flying car. Don't expect too much from it, and it'll be OK.
Also, do you know what apps you're going to run?
You did not realize that when you put the thing in? I asked you why you wanted a NEW OS due to boredom.
